newsitem.title: USA: Canyon Resources starts Ethiopian drilling.
newsitem.headline: Canyon Resources starts Ethiopian drilling.

text.p: Canyon Resources Corp said it has started a drilling program focused on several gold targets of its Megado Serdo property in southern Ethiopia.
It also said exploration on two other properties in the country have located significant gold occurrences.

Canyon's gold exploration in Ethiopia is being conducted by Canyon Resources Africa Ltd, a 90 percent-owned subsidiary of Canyon Resources, and funded by JCI Ltd, a South African mining company, through a joint venture agreement.
The joint venture has committed to spend $1,150,000 in second-year exploration work on the Megado Serdo and Meleka Abeba properties, both located in the Adola Gold Belt of southern Ethiopia.

The 60-square kilometer Megado Serdo property adjoins the two-million ounce Lega Dembi gold mine. Much of the estimated one million ounces of gold recovered from stream gravels by local miners and companies over the past 60 years has been derived from the property.

The 108-square kilometer Meleka Abeba property is located 50 kilometers north of the Lega Dembi Mine, also in the Adola Gold Belt. Local placer miners began gold production in the area some five years ago and are now actively producing gold from gravels associated with most of the drainages within the property.

Canyon said the joint venture has applied for a mineral license covering an area of 1,100 square kilometers within the Rift Valley of northern Ethiopia. The area within the Tendaho application contains numerous gold values and alteration indicative of an important geothermal system.
